seasons.Spring: We’re helping neighbors get ahead of spring growth so trees don’t overtake the yard.
seasons.Summer: With heat drying heavy limbs, folks are trimming before they snap.
seasons.Fall: We’re storm-proofing trees before wind and rain hit.
seasons.Winter: After these storms, we’re checking weakened branches and hazards.

audience.Pros: Most people hire us because it’s faster than a weekend on a ladder.
audience.Retirees: Peace of mind is the big win—no surprises when wind picks up.

core.opener: Hi, I’m Nick with Cascade Tree Works. Quick question—
core.ask: —any trees you’ve been meaning to trim or check before the weather?
core.close: Great—what’s the best name and number for a free quote?

Already have someone.A: That’s great—most folks like a second opinion for comparison.
Already have someone.B: We often help even if you’ve got a regular—especially for storm prep.

Not interested.A: All good—I’ll leave our info in case a limb acts up.
Not interested.B: Understood—calls jump after a gusty night; we’d rather prevent it.

Too busy.A: Totally—takes 10 seconds to put you on the free-quote list.
Too busy.B: No problem—what’s a quick time window and we’ll work around you?

Cost.A: Estimates are free—we can focus on the risk spots only.
Cost.B: We’ll show options—often a trim beats a removal.

Later.A: Sure—want me to note a check before the next storm front?
Later.B: No rush—if I leave info, you’ve got us when you’re ready.

Renter.A: Got it—usually the landlord handles tree work. I’ll leave our info for them.
Renter.B: If you’d like, I can note the property manager’s contact for a quote.
